What is FHE?

Fully Homomorphic Encryption (FHE) is a way of encrypting data in such a way that it can be processed (e.g., added, multiplied) in encrypted form without having to decrypt it. This allows you to perform calculations on encrypted data without revealing its contents, which ensures a high level of confidentiality when processing information.

* ʥ ϡ 7

This allows you to perform calculations on encrypted data without revealing its contents, which ensures a high level of confidentiality when processing information.

Where FHE can it be useful?

Finance

In the financial industry, FHE can be used to protect financial transactions and customer data when processing payments and financial transactions

Cybersecurity

Computer security is a section of information security that characterizes the impossibility of damage to a computer exceeding the amount of damage

Science & Development

FHE is used in research and development to ensure privacy and security when processing sensitive data
